author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Is it expected that the `safe` block lags behind `latest` quite a bit on both Goerli and Sepolia?  For example on Sepolia:

```
> eth.getBlockByNumber("latest", false).number - eth.getBlockByNumber("safe", false).number
42
> eth.getBlockByNumber("latest", false).number - eth.getBlockByNumber("safe", false).number
42
> eth.getBlockByNumber("latest", false).number - eth.getBlockByNumber("safe", false).number
44
```

My rough understanding was the `safe` should only lag behind latest by 4s or so?  Is this due to low participation or finality issues?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Seems more like `safe` is roughly 1 epoch ahead of finalized?

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Ah just saw this somewhat being discussed in <#892088344438255616> 

> There is an idea to improve safe block algorithm over time to reduce its distance behind the head, ideally to [0; 1] range. The work on that is being in progress

I (and perhaps many others) thought this was already implemented.

author: potuz
content: this is not an implementation detail, there's no sound concept of safe head along those lines yet
